Reviews.Title: “Good value but not near centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BooBoo154
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located close to airport which is great if staying here in order to catch early flight. However for those wanting to explore the centre of Madrid be prepared for metro journey of about 20mins or so. Wasn't an issue for us but some might feel its a bit far from the action. Room was decent size and had all features expected of 4* hotel. Swimming pool lovely. Breakfast was buffet- very tasty and good choice. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great service”
Reviews.Author: ludelmonte
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Tryp Alcala, the hotel is located only 10 mins by bus from the the Airport Barajas, 3 minutes walking distance from the metro which take you to the city center within 25 mins, highly recommended. The room was good and clean, the swiming pool facilities were good, altough it is available quite late around 11h30. The service was fenomenal and that was what made this hotel so special. The staff was amazing, very friendly and a attentive, made us feel very welcome and treat us like part of their family we´ve met great people here thank you very much

Reviews.Title: “I wavered on the rating”
Reviews.Author: noogs1
Reviews.Content: It is a bit far out. But, not bad on the metro. It is clean, the rooms are nice. The beds are comfy. It's kind of like a Holiday Inn Express. The breakfast is very nice. But, there is NOTHING outstanding about this facitlity. It is just there and avoids crisicism. The staff is very nice and helpful. And I have to say the maid was excellent. If what you want is a comfortable place to sleep and wifi and close access to buses and metro. this is fine. I would stay there again and I would not stay in average again. So I gave it 4.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sibinsanks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife. I wouldn't class this as a 4* but certainly upper 3*. Carpets need attention. Rooms are very neat and clean. 3 cheers to hotel staff. Everyone of them were really friendly and helpful. I requested a change of room as the double room that I had had 2 separate single beds and I wanted a double bed. We were outside and came late night to the hotel. By then they had organised the room change and even changed our luggage to the new room! Decent size swimming pool. The highlight has to be the massive breakfast feats! The breakfast is endless and you can sit there eating the variety all day. Not to say its a bit on the higher side (£14.00 per person) but remember to sign up for MAS point card (group hotel points system) so you get the breakfast for half price and also internet for free. Otherwise there is a charge for internet (£20.00 per day). The Canjillas metro station is only 5 minutes walk and you get tickets to GranVia (Madrid central) for 1.50 Euro each way. The journey is 25 - 30 mins. Over all a very good experience and I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel a quick bus ride from the airport and short walk from the metro Canillejas with a large outdoor pool. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Davethebunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights having booked on last minute .com. We had excellent service through our whole stay. On arrival we were upgraded to a superior room with superking bed and being a mas rewards point card holder (free to join!) we were given a late check out (2pm) free wifi and 50% breakfast. Who could ask for more? The pool although small was lovely given the 37degree heat and the area was 15mins max from the centre of madrid taking the green line all the way from Canillejas station (2mins walk up the road) all the way to Gran Via. Given it was Madrid pride when we arrived we were pleased of the quiet area our hotel was located in and gave us the perfect access to visit the bullring at ventas and the Bernabeu stadium. The bus 101 takes you to and from Barajas airport for 1 Euro, a bargain in this climate and the bus station is again 2 mins walk from the hotel. Could not fault this property and will definately return again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Money.”
Reviews.Author: tjpines
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here. The room was small and they didn't have the AC running prior to our arrival. So we turned it on pior to going into city. Apparently not working well since it didn't really cool the room, but it wasn't much cooler in the lobby. They do have a nice breafast and it is close to the airport. It is about 200 yards from the metro which will take you into plaza del sol in about 35 minutes for 1 euro. However, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place though not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: drtravels
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel via priceline (essentially same cost as hotel website) when hoping for the Hilton. I've been to both and clearly the Hilton is a superior hotel in the same category. Good: Prompt email response. Easy access via bus 200 from the airport. Close to the metro. Decent neighborhood with local places to eat. Less than 30 minutes to airport via walking/bus. Staff very friendly and helpful (internet is 12 euros/day but employee advised if I joined their free hotel program, I would get it for free). Decent rates online. Bad: Rooms of average size and quality. Intermittent TV and internet reception. I wouldn't use Priceline again for MAD airport hotels but would consider booking this hotel directly. I'd give it a three star level.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice breakfast, nice pool!”
Reviews.Author: bizzykrizzy
Reviews.Content: Check-in was done by a very friendly and helpful receptionist. The room was a good size with air conditioning. It was facing the busy street so although widows can be opened it's quite noisy. The bathroom has a hair dryer, magnifying mirror, plenty of hot water at any time of day, and nice samples of l'Oreal toiletries. It was all very clean. The bed had an excellent mattress, not too soft at all. The tv had an adequate range of BBC and CNN channels. On the day of check-out they kindly extended our time from 12 to 3pm which was very convenient. I would rate the hotel a real 4 star - possibly at the lower end but higher than 3 stars. The breakfast is truly exceptional - both the presentation and the taste of everything on offer is wonderful. A range of juices, breads, cheeses, meats and croissants, thick creamy yogurt, delicious cakes. And when we went in Aug 2010 this buffet only cost 8€ per person! Really well worth it. The pool is not huge but adequate (with a life guard on duty as well) with free towels and nice sun loungers. I enjoyed topping up my tan there alternating with refreshing dips into the pool. I would recommend this hotel as we had a very relaxing and comfortable stay there but it's far from the city centre and the travelling back and forth can wear you down. The nearest underground station (called Cannillejas) is less than 5 min on foot from the hotel though and the line (no 5) goes straight into the heart of town (stop called Callao) in about 25 min. The trains are frequent and very clean. They felt very safe to me. Each journey cost 1€ and there are deals for a booklet of 10 tickets and 1 or 2 day tickets. Trains run until 1.30am. In the immediate vicinity there's nothing much to look at and only a few facilities like cafes. There was only one real restaurant we found and one small supermarket to buy bottles of water etc. Cannillejas is very well served by buses as well as the underground - if you're coming from the airport you can take the bus 204 from terminal 4 or the 200 (which seemed very frequent) and the 101 (less frequent) from terminals 1, 2 or 3. All these buses go to Cannillejas in about 10min (in this case, much quicker than taking the underground). It only cost 1€ and your day ticket for zone A will take you back there on your return as well. Calle de Alcala is an extremely long road by the way, which goes right into the heart of the city centre. I would not recommend trying to walk it though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tiayolanda
Reviews.Content: If you are ever in Madrid and need a hotel close to the airport that will afford you a comfortable and quiet night's sleep...Tryp Alcala 611 is it. This hotel is clean, modern and close to the airport. You can reach the Barajas airport in less than 10 min for 20 euros. A bit pricey but the night before a long flight ...one needs a dependable hotel that will deliver a clean quiet room. Ask the front desk to order your cab for the next morning. That and a wake up call is all you'll need. A little pricey with the internet but there is a internet cafe across the street that is cheapo!

Reviews.Title: “standard hotel - close to airport”
Reviews.Author: peachy_marc
Reviews.Content: my wife and me booked the tryp 611 through priceline, which gave us a reasonable price. the hotel unfortunately doesn´t offer a complimentary shuttle. we decided to take the public bus to get there, which wasn´t so easy. location is alright, since the hotel is close to the metro (canillejas station). room was small, but clean. bathroom was standard (with bathtub) for a european 4 star hotel. the hotel doesn´t offer free complimentary wifi, which sucks. bed was mediocre (2 single beds pushed together, since they didn´t have enough double beds in non-smoking rooms). all in all an ok experience. service fair enough for the priceline price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: patriciasilva
Reviews.Content: I've just came back from Madrid and stayed three nights at Tryp Alcalá 611 (for the price of two). My first impression of the bedroom was that it was quite small - I was expecting a king-size bed - this is one of the main problems of the hotel, you can't ask for a double room while making the reservation; when you do the check-in, if there is a double room, you'll get it, otherwise twin (we were 2 couples arriving at midnight and the very friendly man at the reception desk searched and searched and found two double rooms for each one of us). Nevertheless, the room was very clean, the bed very cosy and comfortable, bathroom impecable. Breakfast with a wide variety of food. Nice pool - we went there every day, from 12h to 17h, as it was so hot (40º) it was impossible to visit Madrid. Fantastic. In spite of not being central, we got to the centre in approximately 20 minutes by metro. The station (Canillejas) is in a 3 minutes walking distance from the hotel and it runs till 2 a.m. I think it's a great value for money, not a 4-star hotel and not central, but I enjoyed so much that next time I'll be there again. The thing I most appreciated was the friendliness of the staff. They were great, always available to help, very attentive. It is possible to left the luggage at the hotel after check-in and use the pool also before your flight - that was what we did. I truly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent option”
Reviews.Author: Apollo14
Reviews.Content: This was a choice based solely on price - a very good rate sent from the hotel group in an email to me. The location is *not* central, but has the advantage of being a short bus ride (101) from the airport, then a 3 minute walk over the temporary bridge and up the street (Alcala). The hotel is 4 minutes walk from a metro station <Canillejas>, on Line 5. About 25 minutes ride into Callao, near Puerta el Sol. The hotel was clean, modern - probably a good 3-star. Good bathroom. Reception was efficient, and we had no other contact with the staff. There is a good-sized swimming pool outside at the back, which remained unused by us due to the snow and ice! If coming for a week in the summer I would consider the hotel, as outdoor swimming pools are rare in Madrid and a dip would be welcome in the heat. All in all, I would not recommend for first-time weekenders as it is not central and requires some time on the metro. But for a reasonably-priced week in the summer, it could be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice but never a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silkchild_77
Reviews.Content: Hotel was at good location, 10 min on taxi from airport and 5 min walk to metro station. it took approx 40 min into centre of Madrid on the metro. Hotel was clean, staff polite and helpful and my stay was good. BUT the amenity was not that of 4* hotel at all - more like 2*. *No coffee/tea making facility *No free towels (20 euro deposit for a towel?!) for the pool *No free internet - paying 2 euro for 15 min connection extortionate. *Patio area next to pool was crumbling and in dire need to repair - I was silly enough to walk from pool to sun-lounger bare feet and loose pebbles/stones really hurt my feet. *Very limited choice of English language channel available. Yes, I know TV isn't everything but like most English people I don't speak much Spanish/French/German. We had CNN but sound was bust and they took literally days to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMCW
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that I would happily return to. It is a little bit out of town and not as central a location as I’d usually go for but this is the only drawback I could think of. I went to Madrid on business and appreciated the courtesy, friendliness and efficiency of the service from all staff. The rooms are a good size (could perhaps do with a lick of paint), the showers excellent and the air-conditioning, works! I was on the fourth floor, slept soundly every night and wasn’t disturbed by fellow guests at all. Breakfast is good with a wide selection of food and drink. The restaurant staff don’t speak much English but hey, this is Spain and so it was a good opportunity to practice my Spanish! The reception staff were excellent – they were knowledgeable on Madrid and their service felt very personalised; my husband called me every night only giving my room number when asking to be put through to me but was surprised to hear them referring to me by my Christian name – a nice touch. The hotel offers internet access at 2€ for thirty minutes and 3€ for an hour. The rooms have a connection point but if you can only access by a wireless connection, you’ll have to go down to reception and pay to use the hotel’s computer. There was a bar but it wasn’t opened throughout my week-long stay. This wasn’t a problem as there were vending machines selling snacks and hot & cold drinks. I didn’t use the pool but there were loungers outside and although it was very basic (and very uninspiring – too much concrete), it looked OK. Check out is at 12noon but if you ask, you can delay it until 3pm… very considerate! The surrounding area is residential doesn’t offer much at all – for travellers, there is: a shop (handy for bottled water), some bars & restaurants and lots of cash points. If I returned to Madrid on business and didn’t have to be near the centre, this hotel would be my first point of call. If you’re going for sightseeing and a city break in general, head for somewhere more central. Other reviews have said that the metro is close by and that it only takes 15 mins to get into town - a good point to consider if budget is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ElanaLou
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break in Madrid and was very impressed with the standard of this modern hotel and service all round. Our room rate included Breakfast, which was a wonderful treat (never seen such a variety of items on display!). Very close to the airport, which was very convenient as we had to leave very early on Sunday morning. However from the hotel to the city centre (Canillejas to Gran Via) it only takes 15 minutes when using the Metro, and therefore offers much better rates than other hotels in the city centre. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Tryp Alcala Not 4-star”
Reviews.Author: jdavis11007
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tryp Alcala hotel in Madrid through Priceline and what a disappointment it was. We were expecting a 4-star hotel, but what we got instead was a rip off. The hotel is indeed newly renovated, albeit in a location that is far from ideal. It is relatively close to the airport, but there's no decent restaurant either in the hotel itself, or in the immediate environs. Thus, we arrived tired and exhausted at 9:30 p.m., expecting to eat in the hotel restaurant and get to bed. After getting very bad advice from the sole receptionist on duty (who was engrossed in a private phone conversation), we spent the next two hours walking through some very unattractive streets and then taking a bus to the end of nowhere until we gave up and ate chicken wings at an outdoor beer hall. By then, the bus had stopped running, (no warning at all from our dear hotel receptionist whom we tried to consult for advice) and we couldn't even hail a taxi. All this with an 11-year-old in tow! Hot, exhausted and very angry, we returned to the hotel at close to midnight, having walked the whole way back. The only refreshments available at the hotel were from a sole vending machine in the small lobby, although the room had a small refrigerator -- with nothing in it. There's supposed to be a tiny corner bar in the lobby, but it was not staffed and seemed there only for show. The breakfast the next morning was quite good, but by then, we were ready to leave this hotel and never, ever return. Oh, and there's supposed to be a shuttle bus for this 4-star hotel. Turns out it'll pick you up (a half hour after you call) from the airport. But getting back to the airport is another matter. The shuttle runs only for two hours in the morning, and two in the evening. If you happen to have a flight outside of the exact times their shuttle runs, you're outta luck. Overall, this hotel is not to be recommended for either service or location. And the room we stayed in was little more than a cubicle with two twin beds that three people had to share. Not a 4-star hotel by any standards.

HotelInfo.Name: Tryp Alcala 611
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Alcala 611 - 613, 28022 Madrid, Spain
